reasoning: Foreign body granuloma is a reactive histological finding from retained foreign materials. Incidence varies by context (skin, lung, GI). Estimated incidence ~3-8 per 100k based on dermatology and pathology studies. Confidence limited as diagnosis depends on specific clinical context.
source: Mackie RM et al. (2001). Foreign body granulomas. In: Rook/Wilkinson/Ebling Textbook of Dermatology. 7th ed. London: Blackwell Science.
